title: Domain 3.1: Explain basic cable types and their connecotors, features, and purposes.
content:
ğŸ§µ 3.1 â€“ Network Cables

ğŸ“¡ Coaxial Cable

Used for cable internet, TV, and older networks. Uses an F-type connector.
RG-6 and RG-59 are common variants.

ğŸ§  Tip: If you see "cable modem" or "TV splitter," it's coax.

ğŸ›¡ï¸ Shielded Twisted Pair (STP)

Twisted pair cable with metal shielding. Reduces EMI.

â–ªï¸ Direct Burial: Extra protection for underground use (water-resistant, durable).

ğŸ§  Tip: Use STP/direct burial outdoors or near heavy machinery.

ğŸ§µ Unshielded Twisted Pair (UTP)

Most common Ethernet cable. Lighter, cheaper, easier to install.

ğŸ§  Tip: Common in offices, homes, patch cables.

ğŸ”¥ Plenum-Rated Cable

Special insulation for air ducts and ceilings. Fire-resistant, low smoke.

ğŸ§  Tip: Required by code in HVAC spaces.

ğŸ’¡ Fiber Optic Cable

Sends light instead of electrical signals. High-speed and EMI-immune.

ğŸ§  Tip: Used for long distances, between buildings, or by ISPs.

ğŸ”  T568A / T568B Wiring Standards

RJ-45 pinout wiring standards. A on one end, B on the other = crossover. Same = straight-through.

ğŸ® Peripheral Cables

ğŸ”Œ USB 2.0 & 3.0

  • USB 2.0 â€“ 480 Mbps, black tab
  • USB 3.0 â€“ 5 Gbps, blue tab, backward compatible

ğŸ”„ Serial

Legacy 9-pin RS-232 ports for config/barcode/POS.

âš¡ Thunderbolt

Data + video + power via USB-C. Used in docks, displays, drives.

ğŸ–¥ï¸ Video Cables

  • HDMI: Audio + video, up to 4K+
  • DisplayPort: High bandwidth, locking latch
  • DVI: Older monitors, no audio
  • VGA: Analog only, fuzzy legacy video

ğŸ’½ Hard Drive Cables

  • SATA: Internal modern drive cable
  • SCSI: Enterprise/RAID, legacy
  • eSATA: External SATA, not powered
  • IDE: Ribbon-style legacy cable

ğŸ” Adapters

  • USB-to-Ethernet
  • DVI-to-HDMI
  • Lightning-to-3.5mm
  • DisplayPort-to-VGA

ğŸ§  Tip: Not all adapters convert power/audio.

ğŸ”Œ Connector Types

  • RJ11 â€“ Phones/modems
  • RJ45 â€“ Ethernet
  • F-Type â€“ Coax
  • ST/SC/LC â€“ Fiber (LC = Little Connector)
  • Punchdown block â€“ Terminating UTP in panels
  • microUSB/miniUSB â€“ Legacy USB
  • USB-C â€“ Reversible, modern standard
  • Molex â€“ Legacy desktop power
  • Lightning â€“ Apple-only
  • DB9 â€“ Serial devices

ğŸ–¼ï¸ Cable Tables

Visual summaries of common cable types, speeds, and uses:
